719642f-a.title: Manhattan: Elizabeth Street - East Houston
719642f-a.text:
Elizabeth Street, west side, north from, but not including East Houston, to and including Bleecker Streets. Shown is the Church of Our Lady of Loretto, R.C. at No. 307, adjoining the S.W. corner of Prince Street.
February 21, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

not a typo but an error:
"...adjoining the S.W. corner of Prince Street."
If it's looking north from Houston it should be "Bleecker Street," not ...Prince Street."

Robert Iulo
robiulo@aol.com
719642f-a.folder: Elizabeth Street & East Houston, Manhattan, NY

719464f-a.text:
East Houston Street, south side, west from (No. 63) but not including Elirabeth, to Broadway. Note the 9-story Puck Building (with figure) extending from Mulberry to Lafayette Streets. Clearance in the foreground
is on the north side of East Houston Street.
June 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
719464f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Elizabeth Street, Manhattan, NY

719467f-a.text:
(gR
East Houston Street, south side, east from and including Elizabeth Street, to, but not including the Bowery. Also shown is Elizabeth Street, east side, south from and including East Houston, to, but not including Prince Streets.
June 3, 1933.
L. Sperr.  NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719467f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Elizabeth Street, Manhattan, NY

719466f-a.text:
East Houston Street, north side, east from and including Elizabeth Street, showing the clearance created by the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there, to make way for the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also shown is the Houston Street station of the Third Ave. Elevated Line, on the Bowery. In the left foreground appear Nos. 288 and 290 (right to left) Elizabeth Street, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of East Houston Street.(The corner is a clearance).
March 12, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
719466f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Elizabeth Street, Manhattan, NY

719463f-a.text:
East Houston Street, north side, west from Elizabeth Street, to but not including Mulberry, after crossing Mott Streets. Also shown (right) are Nos. 281 to 285 Elizabeth Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of East Houston Street. These houses were later demolished to facilitate the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway); their site is now (1937) being used as a playground and Park.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
719463f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Elizabeth Street, Manhattan, NY
